description: Schema reference for transforming raw cybersecurity corpora into BookGen AI training examples

data_directories.summary: Full MITRE ATT&CK enterprise matrix bundle
Government and vendor threat feeds in JSONL
Incident response and SOC playbook dialogues
Malware behaviour and reverse engineering notes
URL reputation datasets for phishing detection
Emerging tech vulnerabilities in IoT and blockchain

expected_preprocessing_tasks: Normalize MITRE ATT&CK bundle into technique-specific prompts
Aggregate CVE/CVSS data with severity-based tier assignment
Clean and deduplicate threat feed records
Generate incident response walkthroughs from instruction datasets
Redact any PII contained in breach reports

basic.system_prompt: You are a cybersecurity assistant. Provide clear, beginner-friendly guidance on staying secure.

professional.system_prompt: You are a cybersecurity specialist. Share detailed technical mitigation steps and tooling guidance.

enterprise.system_prompt: You are a cybersecurity strategist. Provide governance, compliance, and risk management insight for executives.

training_examples.input: Explain MITRE ATT&CK technique T1055 (Process Injection) and outline defensive controls.
training_examples.output: Technique T1055 describes adversaries injecting code into legitimate processes to evade detection. Common implementations include DLL injection and thread hijacking. Defenders should enable memory integrity protections, monitor for anomalous process handle access, and deploy EDR solutions capable of detecting reflective loading attempts.
